limbs.label: 3 Part Bone with Foot
limbs.description: This is the same as Bone with Foot except that the three sections of the limb are all generated as totally separate paths in the limb layer.The three stroke colors have not been linked to the Upper, Middle and Lower color of the Limber effect (but they could be).If you don’t want the foot, simply delete the Foot Group from the limb layer.

limbs.label: Bone with Foot
limbs.description: This limb adds a fourth point to the end of the bone path as a foot, with controls for length, and the angles of the foot’s tangents. Those controls can be used to simulate  toe and heel roll as demonstrated here.

limbs.label: Colored Bone
limbs.description: This limb replicates the color controls of a Taper limb, in a bone. You can set three colors, alter the point at which they split, and the rounding of those splits, all using the standard properties in the Limber effect.But unlike Tapers, you can still use Bone Curvature to round out the joint, and everything is based on stroked paths instead of filled shapes.Use the Middle Size to control the stroke width.

limbs.label: Faux 3D Bone
limbs.description: This Bone adds a Faux 3D look using two strokes with Trim Paths.It uses the Start and End Sizes, Colors, Lower Split and Lower Rounding properties in the Limber effect.This limb only works as expected when the End Size is smaller than the Start Size.

limbs.label: Faux 3D Sleeve
limbs.description: This is based on Faux 3D Bone but has an open appearance to the sleeve end.

limbs.label: Offset Bone
limbs.description: This limb is designed for cases where you want to offset a bone path on one side only, eg. for a stripe on one side of a leg.There are controls on the limb layer for the amount of offset and subdivision (smoothness) of the path. It gets more CPU-intensive as you increase the subdivision.  You may want to reduce the subdivision until you come to render.Tip: if you don’t want bendiness, try setting Bone Curvature to 0.1 and reduce the Offset Path Subdivision to 2.

limbs.label: Riggable Bone
limbs.description: Basic bones won’t work with the Rig & Pose button. This one will.

limbs.label: Stroked Bone
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer for Stroke Color and Width. This limb uses the Color and Split controls in the Limber effect, but ignores Rounding.This limb only works as expected when the Sizes are smaller towards the end.

limbs.label: Tapered Bone
limbs.description: After Effects v17.1 introduced native Tapered Strokes. This is one way to use them with Bones.This limb uses the Color, Split and Rounding controls in the Limber effect.This limb only works as expected when the Sizes are smaller towards the end.

limbs.label: 3 Part Bone with Foot
limbs.description: This is the same as Bone with Foot except that the three sections of the limb are all generated as totally separate paths in the limb layer.The three stroke colors have not been linked to the Upper, Middle and Lower color of the Limber effect (but they could be).If you don’t want the foot, simply delete the Foot Group from the limb layer.

limbs.label: Bone with Foot
limbs.description: This limb adds a fourth point to the end of the bone path as a foot, with controls for length, and the angles of the foot’s tangents. Those controls can be used to simulate  toe and heel roll as demonstrated here.

limbs.label: Colored Bone
limbs.description: This limb replicates the color controls of a Taper limb, in a bone. You can set three colors, alter the point at which they split, and the rounding of those splits, all using the standard properties in the Limber effect.But unlike Tapers, you can still use Bone Curvature to round out the joint, and everything is based on stroked paths instead of filled shapes.Use the Middle Size to control the stroke width.

limbs.label: Faux 3D Bone
limbs.description: This Bone adds a Faux 3D look using two strokes with Trim Paths.It uses the Start and End Sizes, Colors, Lower Split and Lower Rounding properties in the Limber effect.This limb only works as expected when the End Size is smaller than the Start Size.

limbs.label: Faux 3D Sleeve
limbs.description: This is based on Faux 3D Bone but has an open appearance to the sleeve end.

limbs.label: Offset Bone
limbs.description: This limb is designed for cases where you want to offset a bone path on one side only, eg. for a stripe on one side of a leg.There are controls on the limb layer for the amount of offset and subdivision (smoothness) of the path. It gets more CPU-intensive as you increase the subdivision.  You may want to reduce the subdivision until you come to render.Tip: if you don’t want bendiness, try setting Bone Curvature to 0.1 and reduce the Offset Path Subdivision to 2.

limbs.label: Riggable Bone
limbs.description: Basic bones won’t work with the Rig & Pose button. This one will.

limbs.label: Stroked Bone
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer for Stroke Color and Width. This limb uses the Color and Split controls in the Limber effect, but ignores Rounding.This limb only works as expected when the Sizes are smaller towards the end.

limbs.label: Tapered Bone
limbs.description: After Effects v17.1 introduced native Tapered Strokes. This is one way to use them with Bones.This limb uses the Color, Split and Rounding controls in the Limber effect.This limb only works as expected when the Sizes are smaller towards the end.

limbs.label: Angled Splits
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to change the split angles. Rounding is ignored for this limb.

limbs.label: Expanded Splits
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to change the expansion.This limb may only work as expected when the Sizes are smaller towards the end.

limbs.label: Foot with Toes
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to alter the foot.

limbs.label: Hand
limbs.description: Alter the shapes inside the limb layer’s Hand Group to suit your needs. This group rotates as if it were parented to the End Controller eg. with the Rotate End property.Unlike Simple Foot, the hand group will not flip with the Clockwise property.

limbs.label: Jake's Kneepad
limbs.description: This limb has a unique Joint Group inside the shape, which will automatically align with the angle and position of the knee, similar to if you parented a layer to a Joint Controller with it’s auto-rotation set to Outwards.There are controls on the limb layer to alter the kneepad, or you could edit the contents of the Joint Group to suit your needs.

limbs.label: Kurt's Elbow Crease
limbs.description: This limb is designed to add a stroke to the limb with a crease in the inner joint. There are controls on the limb layer for the start and end angle that the crease occurs between, as well as the stroke color and weight.The stroke on the lower split is turned off but can be re-enabled.

limbs.label: Kurt's Elbow Crease T shirt
limbs.description: This limb is based on Kurt’s Elbow Crease but adds a wider T-shirt style split in the upper limb. There are controls on the limb layer to adjust the sleeve size.Upper Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Leg Muscles
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the muscles.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Legacy Taper
limbs.description: Based on the default Taper limbs from early versions of Limber (v1.0 - v1.5.x). Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Muscles
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the muscles.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Muscles 2
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the muscles.

limbs.label: Pant
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to change the width and angle of the pant.

limbs.label: Shorts and socks
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the sleeve and position of the stripes.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Simple Foot
limbs.description: A simple integrated foot. The foot rotates as if it were parented to the End Controller, eg. with the Rotate End property. It also flips left-to-right with the Clockwise property.See controls on the limb layer to alter the foot.

limbs.label: Stroked Pant
limbs.description: A more advanced version of the Trouser limb, with some specific extra features.See various controls on the limb layer.

limbs.label: T-shirt
limbs.description: This limb is similar to Shorts and socks. It has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the sleeve and position of the tattoos. Color Splits control three colors all on the Upper limb - the lower limb has no split.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Angled Splits
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to change the split angles. Rounding is ignored for this limb.

limbs.label: Expanded Splits
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to change the expansion.This limb may only work as expected when the Sizes are smaller towards the end.

limbs.label: Foot with Toes
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to alter the foot.

limbs.label: Hand
limbs.description: Alter the shapes inside the limb layer’s Hand Group to suit your needs. This group rotates as if it were parented to the End Controller eg. with the Rotate End property.Unlike Simple Foot, the hand group will not flip with the Clockwise property.

limbs.label: Jake's Kneepad
limbs.description: This limb has a unique Joint Group inside the shape, which will automatically align with the angle and position of the knee, similar to if you parented a layer to a Joint Controller with it’s auto-rotation set to Outwards.There are controls on the limb layer to alter the kneepad, or you could edit the contents of the Joint Group to suit your needs.

limbs.label: Kurt's Elbow Crease
limbs.description: This limb is designed to add a stroke to the limb with a crease in the inner joint. There are controls on the limb layer for the start and end angle that the crease occurs between, as well as the stroke color and weight.The stroke on the lower split is turned off but can be re-enabled.

limbs.label: Kurt's Elbow Crease T shirt
limbs.description: This limb is based on Kurt’s Elbow Crease but adds a wider T-shirt style split in the upper limb. There are controls on the limb layer to adjust the sleeve size.Upper Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Leg Muscles
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the muscles.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Legacy Taper
limbs.description: Based on the default Taper limbs from early versions of Limber (v1.0 - v1.5.x). Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Muscles
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the muscles.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Muscles 2
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the muscles.

limbs.label: Pant
limbs.description: See controls on the limb layer to change the width and angle of the pant.

limbs.label: Shorts and socks
limbs.description: This limb has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the sleeve and position of the stripes.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Simple Foot
limbs.description: A simple integrated foot. The foot rotates as if it were parented to the End Controller, eg. with the Rotate End property. It also flips left-to-right with the Clockwise property.See controls on the limb layer to alter the foot.

limbs.label: Stroked Pant
limbs.description: A more advanced version of the Trouser limb, with some specific extra features.See various controls on the limb layer.

limbs.label: T-shirt
limbs.description: This limb is similar to Shorts and socks. It has controls on the limb layer to adjust the shape of the sleeve and position of the tattoos. Color Splits control three colors all on the Upper limb - the lower limb has no split.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Curved Joint Taper
limbs.description: This limb adds an automated curve to the outer joint and a bone underneath the main filled shape.Use the Bone Curvature property to change the joint curve.Change the limb layer’s Contents > Bezier Taper > C3 Group > Rectangle > Size to alter how the ankle is cropped.

limbs.label: Curved Taper
limbs.description: This limb is based on Square Elbow, but uses Round Corners to smooth the shape.It responds to the Middle Color only, Upper and Lower Color are ignored.See controls on the limb layer to change Rounding value.

limbs.label: Half limb
limbs.description: This limb is intended for use as a matte - check out the Orphaned Limb Layers section of the User Guide to do so.Some properties such as Rounding and Colors are ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Square Elbow
limbs.description: This limb adds a squared off joint.See control on the limb layer for a Square Start control like the normal Square End.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Swept Elbow
limbs.description: This limb is similar to Curved Joint Taper but the sharpness of the outer joint curve is calculated differently and you can also sweep the inner joint.See controls on the limb layer to change the sweep.It responds to the Middle Color only, Upper and Lower Color are ignored.

limbs.label: Three Circles
limbs.description: This limb is designed specifically as a base for rigged artwork and is based on Legacy Taper.  If you want a limb with only the circles at the joints and your own artwork (eg. without Limber’s taper shapes in between) try using this with the Rig & Pose function.

limbs.label: Curved Joint Taper
limbs.description: This limb adds an automated curve to the outer joint and a bone underneath the main filled shape.Use the Bone Curvature property to change the joint curve.Change the limb layer’s Contents > Bezier Taper > C3 Group > Rectangle > Size to alter how the ankle is cropped.

limbs.label: Curved Taper
limbs.description: This limb is based on Square Elbow, but uses Round Corners to smooth the shape.It responds to the Middle Color only, Upper and Lower Color are ignored.See controls on the limb layer to change Rounding value.

limbs.label: Half limb
limbs.description: This limb is intended for use as a matte - check out the Orphaned Limb Layers section of the User Guide to do so.Some properties such as Rounding and Colors are ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Square Elbow
limbs.description: This limb adds a squared off joint.See control on the limb layer for a Square Start control like the normal Square End.Rounding is ignored in this limb.

limbs.label: Swept Elbow
limbs.description: This limb is similar to Curved Joint Taper but the sharpness of the outer joint curve is calculated differently and you can also sweep the inner joint.See controls on the limb layer to change the sweep.It responds to the Middle Color only, Upper and Lower Color are ignored.

limbs.label: Three Circles
limbs.description: This limb is designed specifically as a base for rigged artwork and is based on Legacy Taper.  If you want a limb with only the circles at the joints and your own artwork (eg. without Limber’s taper shapes in between) try using this with the Rig & Pose function.
